name: Crowne Plaza Indianapolis Downtown (Union Station)

reviews.text: We booked this hotel through a service where we we not sure what hotel it would be. When we arrived, we found it to be a very nice hotel. It was clean, and the people were friendly. It was is the downtown area, right next to the RCA dome. The rooms were big, and clean. The noise from the trains were almost non-existant. I found out that when you reserve, ask for a room that is further from the train. The kid loved walking around the hotel, looking at all of the people statues. The pool seemed nice, as well as the hot tub. Only negative was the restaurant - which was not very clean, and the food was typical hotal chain food. It needs major updating. Overall, gerat experience!
reviews.title: Great Stay with Kids

reviews.text: We booked 2 rooms for 6 of us for the Supercross at the RCA Dome. This place is Uber-cool inside. I can't describe it, I can only say we really loved the place. I had my wife and 4 teeneaged boys with me. Everybody was blown away about the train cars converted to rooms, and the little glass elevators were pretty neat for the younger ones. I don't care what anybody says, this place is too cool to believe. Took the boys accross the country on the BIG TRIP last summer. We stayed at 14 different hotels, and this place was at least as good as the best we stayed at. When we travel, we typically get double rooms, and the cost per night per room is over $100, so I am not comparing this place with fleabags. I am acustomed to 4 diamond places like the Greenbrier and Hotel Dupont suites. The kids will remember this place and tell their grandkids about it.
reviews.title: We all loved it!
LOUD and poorly managed
reviews.text: We walked a block or two downtown for dinner on the second night, and we were told the wait was 45 minutes to 2 hours. We went back to the little restaurant in the hotel, and were seated immediately. They served from the bar for drinks, and the food was great. Not to mention we got back to the Supercross on time for the main event. thank you Crowne! My family had a great weekend because of you.
If I can, I am going back next weekend to attend an auction I am watching on HD Theater on TV. That is what prompted me to write a review.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but could use some housekeeping

reviews.text: Go here. U will like it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Break from Work Travel!

reviews.text: I was very excited to stay at the Crowne Plaza Union Station in Indianapolis, but upon arrival I realized that my expectations were set a bit too high. One would think that since we were paying $140 per night, the experience would be a bit more enjoyable. The rooms were very small and a bit worn down. The furniture had been worn in places, however the bed was absolutely wonderful. We stayed on the second floor with a window facing the atrium/pool area. BIG PROBLEM here... It is so noisy because the pool is literally in the middle of all of the rooms, not to mention there was a children's cheerleading convention in town. My boyfriend and I were exhausted from traveling, and could not wait to go for a relaxing swim or have a soak in the spa. Neither of these were an option because there were literally at least 35 kids in the swimming pool, and 16 people in the spa, many under the age of 12 even though the sign posted says that anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an adult. (?) So we not only could not swim or enjoy the spa, but we also had to endure the ridiculous screaming and yelling of kids until 10 PM. NOT relaxing in the least. I called management and asked if there would be any way to have the pool stay open for adults for about 20 to 30 minutes after the kids left. I explained the situation and told him we can't even get IN the pool for one, and the noise in our room was unbearable. One gentleman I spoke with was very nice and said he would have to check on it and would call me back. No one returned my call. I called down again to follow up and spoke to Terry, who was the manager on duty. He proceeded to tell me in a rude and condescending manner that he would not be opening the pool up for people who were unable to use it during that time. Something about a contract which I understand, but I was surprised when he did not offer any solution to the problem.
reviews.title: great hotel but expensive parking

likes.liked: — Location is 30 second walk from all bars/central downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night, and really enjoyed it. We stayed in a train car room, which was great! The hotel is very beautiful, and we found our room to be clean, and nicely decorated. We stayed in the Greta Garbo train car. This is the perfect location for exploring the downtown area as it is in walking distance to Circle Center Mall, Pan-Am Plaza, the sports complexes, and many great places to eat. We hardly even noticed the trains. You could just feel a very faint rumbling, which was really quite neat. I would highly recommend one of the train rooms for a fun and unique experience.
reviews.title: Unique Experience

reviews.text: I had just come from staying in the Marriott in downtown Indy to this hotel. They are the same star rating: 3 and booked both on Priceline for $50/night. This hotel was far inferior. While the location is really good, easy walking distance to everything central even in 20 degree weather, the hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. The fact that it's in a train station is fun and the kids really enjoyed seeing the rooms in train cars, but it is loud throughout the night. They do give you earplugs, a CD, and a night mask, but I still couldn't sleep. Moved rooms to the third floor from the second on night two and that helped some. The windows face an open atrium in the hotel instead of outside which add extra noise. The interior is very shabby, carpet worn, bathrooms from the 80's or so, bu the beds are nice. Stay away from the restaurant, very run down and much better choices within walking distance. Overall: Okay for Priceline, but not if you pay full price. When it is renovated, it will be better I'm sure.
reviews.title: Not super impressed: loud rooms, shabby interior

reviews.text: The Crowne Plaza is located in an old (but still functioning) train station so it has plenty of character. The hotel is directly across the street from the RCA Dome, diagonally located from the new Lucas Oil stadium ((still under construction) and just a block from the Circle City mall. It is very convenient.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, A Little Worn Down
very interesting hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in an old passenger train car. We had always wanted to stay in the train cars, but now that we did, we won't do it again. The car was very long and narrow, it was only a little wider than the beds were long. Each car is named after a famous American, ours was the John Philip Sousa car so it had a patriotic theme inside. I think a nice touch would have been to have a short description of the famous American's contributions.

Although the room had character, it was very worn looking. The carpets were unraveling at the edge. All the wood trim was very scuffed up and looked quite dirty. The bathroom door had stains that looked like something (coffee or soda) had spilled on the door, but was never cleaned.
reviews.title: The Train Noise Wasn't the Problem

aka: Crowne Plaza Indianapolis Downtown (Union Station) Hotel
description: Take a video tour. Listed in the National Register of Historic Places and located in the heart of downtown Indianapolis, the Crowne Plaza Hotel and Conference Center at Historic Union Station is 'housed within America's first Union Station.' Our hotel s downtown Indianapolis location is ideal. We re just steps away from both the Indiana Convention Center & Lucas Oil Stadium, home of the Indianapolis Colts & convenient to Conseco Fieldhouse, Circle Centre Mall, The Indianapolis Zoo & White River Gardens, The Eiteljorg Museum, Indianapolis Motor Speedway & Hall of Fame Museum, NCAA Hall of Champions, The Children s Museum & downtown nightlife. Our Romanesque revival-style hotel features 273 guestrooms, Pullman's Restaurant & Lounge and over 50,000 sq ft of meeting space. We're best known for our 26 authentic Pullman traincar guestrooms named & decorated after prominent personalities from the early 1900's. Another popular feature of the hotel is the white fiberglass ghost travelers dressed in period clothing, and still lovingly haunting the premises. Our hotel is still an active train station, which enhances its ambiance and authenticity.
